medical_history.chief_complaint: Fever and nodules in the liver and spleen.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient was well until two and a half months before admission when he developed night sweats. Two weeks prior to admission, he moved from the United States to Santo Domingo. He experienced morning fevers each day with a maximum temperature of 40.2Â°C, associated with rigors. Five and a half weeks before admission, he saw a physician, and his weight at that time was 64.9 kg. Four weeks before admission, he developed a nonproductive, dry cough. His fever persisted, occasionally peaking in the evening, despite previous treatments.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Allergic to sulfa medications; immunizations were up to date.
medical_history.family_history: Maternal grandmother had a history of arteriovenous malformations in the liver with bleeding; no family history of cancer or other tumors.
medical_history.social_history: Resided in an urban area in the northeastern United States until moving to the Dominican Republic where he drank untreated water, had no exposure to raw meat, and consumed cooked pork and beef. No sexual contact reported, and there was no known exposure to tuberculosis.
